heading: Training materials for applied epidemiology and public health
text:
website strives :Serve home Applied EpiTM training materialsProvide problem-based teaching address common epidemiological
challengesAssist epidemiologists transitioning RBe accessible settings low internet-connectivity via offline
versions

heading: 0.1 Upcoming live courses
text: Register live course completing reservation form.Click [] read details live course policies.

heading: 0.2 About Applied Epi
text:
Epi R HandbookR packagesSituation report templates  Live R training coursesSelf-paced R tutorialsYouTube
channel  Q&discussion forumR Help DeskCase studiesWritten epidemiologists,

organisation grassroots movement frontline epis around

community. encouragement feedback welcome:Visit website join

text:

heading: Acknowledgements
text:
website produced collaboration epidemiologists 
around world drawing upon experience organizations including
local, state, provincial, national health agencies, World Health
Organization (), Médecins Sans Frontières / Doctors without Borders
(MSF), hospital systems, academic institutions.website approved product specific
organization. Although strive accuracy, provide guarantee
content book.

heading: Funding and support
text:
website received supportive funding via COVID-19 emergency
capacity-building grant TEPHINET, 
global network Field Epidemiology Training Programs (FETPs) 
Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) Operational Centre Amsterdam (OCA).publication supported Cooperative Agreement number
NU2GGH001873, funded Centers Disease Control Prevention
TEPHINET, program Task Force Global Health. 
contents solely responsibility authors 
necessarily represent official views Centers Disease
Control Prevention, Department Health Human Services, 
Task Force Global Health, Inc. TEPHINET.

updates creating contributor guide.Please note epiRhandbook project released

contributing project, agree abide terms.

heading: 1.1 Overview
text:
page hosts training materials Applied EpiTM “Introduction R Applied Epidemiology”.
course teaches fundamentals R applied epidemiologists public health practitioners.

heading: 1.2 Module
text:
list modules included course. Please work way systemically - accordance course timetable.
Clicking tutorial link launch new window interactive exercises.Module 1: Introduction RWe welcome course dive basics interact R RStudio, basic R syntax, organize analytical projects. Finally, cover R functions packages, introduce core functions used import data. Using , import Ebola case study surveillance linelist, begin inspect review .Slides: Welcome, course logistics, RStudio, basic R syntaxSlides: Welcome, course logistics, RStudio, basic R syntaxLive demonstration (instructor guide)Live demonstration (instructor guide)[Tutorial] [Source]Module 4: Data visualization {ggplot2}Using {ggplot2} package maximum effect rests upon understanding apply “grammar graphics” build plot layer--layer. tackle piece--piece, introducing concepts one--one build upon previous knowledge construct informative colorful bar plots, scatter plots, histograms, line plots, text labels automatically update refreshed data (useful epidemiological reports!), .Slides: Data visualization ggplot2Slides: Data visualization ggplot2Slides: Scales, themes, labelsSlides: Scales, themes, labels[Tutorial] [Source]
